intro: Heracleum idae, commonly known as the Alpine cowparsley, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–80 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, forming dense, round clusters at the top of the stems. Heracleum idae thrives in rocky or alpine environments and is often found in meadows and grasslands at high elevations.
